archive.title: Message log archive encryption
archive.defaultKeyNote: This member is configured to use the servers default encryption key. For additional security, consider defining a specific key to be used.

endpoints.deleteEndpointText: Are you sure that you want to delete this endpoint
endpoints.endpointHelp1: Paths is relative to the API base path, e.g. '/pets'. The asterisk (*) can be used as a wildcard
endpoints.endpointHelp3: ** = match zero or more segments, e.g. '/pets/**'.
endpoints.endpointHelp4: Path parameters must be replaced with an asterisk, e.g. '/pets/{id}/images' => '/pets/*/images'.

error_code.client_not_deleted: Unable to delete keys, certificates and CSRs, because they belong to an existing client

conf_verification.anchor_not_for_external_source: Anchor points to an internal configuration source. Only external configuration source anchors are supported as trusted anchors.
conf_verification.missing_private_params: Configuration anchor import failed: invalid anchor file
conf_verification.outdated: Configuration from source is out of date
conf_verification.signature_invalid: Signature of configuration cannot be verified
conf_verification.unreachable: Configuration source cannot be reached, check source URL in uploaded anchor file

error_code.illegal_generated_endpoint_remove: Removing the generated endpoint is not allowed
error_code.illegal_generated_endpoint_update: Updating the generated endpoint is not allowed
error_code.internal_anchor_upload_invalid_instance_: Anchor has an invalid instance id

pin.info1: The software token is the place where the Security Server’s AUTH keys is stored. Please define a PIN to log-in into the software token.
pin.info2: All required information is collected, press the Submit button to to initialise the Security Server.
pin.info3: Once the initialisation is done, you must complete the Security Server configuration - simply click the Configure button in the toast notification that will appear in a few moments.
pin.title: Token PIN

initialConfiguration.title: Initial configuration

internalServers.connectionInfo: Connection type for servers in service provider role is set in the Services tab by the service URL (http/https).

keys.auth_key_with_registered_cert_warning: Key has certificates that need to be unregistered before deletion. Do you want to continue with unregistration and deletion of associated certificates and the key from server configuration? Key ID:
keys.certRegistrationInfo: Security server DNS name or IP address
keys.deleteCsrText: Are you sure that you want to delete this CSR?
keys.deleteKeyText: Are you sure that you want to delete this key and all associated certificates from server configuration?
keys.helpTextApi: API keys are used to authenticate API calls to Security Server’s management REST API. API keys are associated with roles that define the permissions granted to the API key.
keys.helpTextKeys: Authentication key and certificate certify authenticity of a Security Server. They are used for authentication in connections between Security Servers. Signature key and certificate certify authenticity of an X-Road member. They are used for signing and verifying the integrity of mediated messages.
keys.helpTextSS: Security Server’s TLS certificate is used in connections between the Security Server and an information system. The internal TLS certificate is used as both client and server certificate depending on the roles of the Security Server and information system.
keys.label: Label:
keys.unregisterError: Failed to unregister certificate. Continue with certificate deletion anyway?
keys.unregisterText: Do you want to unregister this certificate?

step1.label: Distinguished name
step1.tooltip: The Distinguished Name (DN) uniquely identifies an entity in an X.509 certificate. The following attribute types are commonly found in the DN: CN = Common name, O = Organization name, C = Country code.

step2.description: 2) Generate a new CSR and save it into a safe place

token.pinChanged: Token pin was changed – please log in the token with the new pin
token.tokenPinPolicy: Software token pin is required to be at least 10 ASCII characters from at least tree character classes (lowercase letters, uppercase letters, digits, special characters).

validationError.DecimalMax: numeric value exceeds the maximum allowed
validationError.DecimalMin: numeric value is under the minimum allowed
validationError.Email: value does not meet the email format
validationError.Future: datetime value should be in the future
validationError.FutureOrPresent: datetime value should be now or in the future
validationError.Max: numeric value exceeds the maximum allowed
validationError.Min: numeric value is under the minimum allowed
validationError.Negative: numeric value should be less than zero
validationError.NegativeOrZero: numeric value should be less or equal to zero
validationError.NoBackslashes: value should not contain backslash (\) symbols
validationError.NoColons: value should not contain colon (:) symbols
validationError.NoForwardslashes: value should not contain forward slash (/) symbols
validationError.NoPercents: value should not contain percentage (%) symbols
validationError.NoSemicolons: value should not contain semicolon (;) symbols
validationError.Past: datetime value should be in the past
validationError.PastOrPresent: datetime value should be now or in the past
validationError.Pattern: value did not match the required format
validationError.Positive: numeric value should be greater that zero
validationError.PositiveOrZero: numeric value should be greater or equal to zero
validationError.Size: value does not meet length requirements

client.memberClassTooltip: Code identifying the member class (e.g., government agency, private enterprise etc.).
client.memberCodeTooltip: Member code that uniquely identifies this X-Road member within its member class (e.g. business ID).
client.subsystemCodeTooltip: Subsystem code that identifies an information system owned by the Member.

wizard.clientInfo1: Specify the details of the Client you want to add.
wizard.clientInfo2: If the Client is already existing, you can select it from the Global list.

finish.infoLine1: All required information is collected. By clicking "Submit", the new client will be added to the Clients list and the new key and CSR will appear in the Keys and Certificates view.
finish.infoLine2: In order to register the new client, please complete the following steps:
finish.note: NOTE: if you click Cancel, all data will be lost
finish.title: Finish
finish.todo1: 1) Send the CSR to a Certificate Authority for signing
finish.todo2: 2) Once received back, import the resulting certificate to the corresponding key
finish.todo3: 3) At this point you can register the new client

member.info1: Specify the details of the Member you want to add.
member.info2: If the Member is already existing, you can select it from the Global list.
member.title: Member details

signKey.info: You can define a label for the newly created SIGN key (not mandatory)
signKey.title: Sign Key

subsystem.info1: Specify the code of the subsystem to be added.
subsystem.info2: If the subsystem is already existing, you can select it from the Global list.

token.info: Please select the token where you want to add the SIGN key for the new Client. Note: the token must be in Logged in state.
token.title: Token
